description: From Middle English cirurgical, borrowed from Middle French cirurgical, from Medieval Latin cirurgicālis, ultimately from Ancient Greek χειρουργία (kheirourgía), from χείρ (kheír, “hand”) + ἔργον (érgon, “work”). Replaced Old English Old English læce (“doctor, physician”).

adjectives.description: surgical (comparative more surgical, superlative most surgical)

entries.meaning: Of, relating to, used in, or resulting from surgery.

examples: The building was destroyed with a surgical air-strike.
